none: Come celebrate the Northwestern Community Ensemble's Eleventh Anniversary
Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). Department of Minority Student Affairs
Poster for Hallelujah Anyhow, the Northwestern Community Ensemble's Eleventh Anniversary performance on Saturday, February 18, 1983 at Pick-Staiger Concert Hall.

The images on this site are from material in the collections of the McCormick Library of Special Collections and University Archives of Northwestern University Libraries, are provided for use by its students, faculty and staff, and by other researchers visiting this site, for research consultation and scholarly purposes only. Further distribution and/or any commercial use of the images from this site is not permitted.
Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections API
Homepage at Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections

The collection contains posters whose dates range roughly from 1900 to 2019 assembled by the University Archives. It is an expanding collection, with new items added as they come in. The posters within the collection relate to events held on campus, including music and dance performances, film screenings, talks, seminars, panels, book talks, auditions, career fairs, job opportunities, research studies and course openings, among others. Some events reoccur across time. These events include Homecoming, sports game schedules, concert series held at Bienen School of Music, performances by on-campus theater groups such as Waa-mu and the Northwestern Student Theatre Coalition (StuCo), and, from 2010 onward, One Book Northwestern.
